clinical_study.brief_title: A Prospective Study of a New Immunological Fecal Occult Blood Test
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Study of a New Immunological Fecal Occult Blood Test in Patients Referred for Colonoscopy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the investigators study is to evaluate the diagnostic ability of a new immunological fecal occult blood test in Cuban patients undergoing colonoscopy .

detailed_description.textblock: Colorectal cancer is a major cause of cancer deaths in many countries. Therefore, the importance of screening for the early detection of colorectal cancer is evident. Fecal occult blood screening is proving to be an effective tool for detecting premalignant adenomas and colon cancer since the guaiac-based test was introduced in the late 1960s. However, several immunochemical fecal occult blood tests (IFOBTs) have become commercially available and the majority of these have demonstrated equal or superior sensitivities and specificities than the guaiac-based tests. Therefore, IFOBTs are replacing guaiac based tests despite their higher costs.In this study we evaluate the diagnostic accuracy of a new IFOBT and compare with the findings on colonoscopy.

arm_group.description: All outpatients referred to colonoscopy according to inclusion criteria in the specified period time of one year .

study_pop.textblock: Residents of Havana City admitted at the investigation center.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients (men or women) that are >18 years of age referred to colonoscopy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Visible rectal bleeding
- Known diagnosis of inflammatory bowel disease
- Hematuria
- Menstruation at the time of obtaining a stool specimen
- Patients taking medication such as non steroids anti inflammatory drugs and anticoagulants
